meanings.definition: A person or thing that spaces.
meanings.sent1: The spacer in the group always made sure everyone had enough room.
meanings.sent2: The astronaut used a spacer to measure the distance between the stars.
meanings.sent3: The spacer in the race kept a good distance from the other runners.
meanings.sent4: She was like a spacer, creating harmony and balance among her friends.
meanings.sent5: The spacer in the puzzle helped keep the pieces organized and separate.

meanings.definition: A device used to maintain a specific distance between two objects.
meanings.sent1: The carpenter used a spacer to evenly space the floor tiles.
meanings.sent2: The mechanic inserted a spacer to keep the gears from grinding together.
meanings.sent3: The spacer in the game prevented the pieces from getting too close.
meanings.sent4: The spacer acted like a guardian, ensuring the objects stayed apart.
meanings.sent5: The spacer in the clock mechanism regulated the movement of the hands.

meanings.definition: A piece of material used to create space or separation between components.
meanings.sent1: The designer added a spacer to the necklace to create a layered look.
meanings.sent2: The engineer placed a spacer between the circuit boards to prevent overheating.
meanings.sent3: The spacer in the sandwich kept the ingredients from getting soggy.
meanings.sent4: The spacer functioned like a barrier, keeping the parts from touching.
meanings.sent5: The spacer in the bookshelf ensured each shelf had enough space for the books.
